headline: Banana Crumb Muffins
description: The best banana muffin recipes have a sweet crumb topping which is what makes these banana muffins stand apart from the ordinary. They're scrumptious!

video.description: The crumb topping makes these muffins extra yummy.
video.name: Banana Crumb Muffins

name: Banana Crumb Muffins

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease or line 10 muffin cups with paper liners.
Prepare muffins: Mix flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl.

Beat bananas, white sugar, melted butter, and egg together in a separate bowl; stir the banana mixture into the flour mixture just until combined. Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups, filling each about 3/4 full.
Prepare crumb topping: Mix brown sugar, flour, and cinnamon together in a small bowl. Use a fork to mix in 1 tablespoon butter until mixture is crumbly; sprinkle topping over muffins.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 18 to 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Easy recipe , decided to make a large cake

My family LOVES these muffins .. especially warm out of the oven. My only tweak was I used 1 tsp vanilla in the batter as well as a dash or two of cinnamon, simply because we all love those flavors but certainly not necessary!

Super easy to make! The only adjustment I made was using 1/2 brown and 1/2 white sugar in the bread. I honestly would give this recipe a 4 but my Honey ate 4 and said it was the best banana bread/muffin he‚Äôd ever eaten!

This recipe caught my eye because it called for 3 bananas (i see many with only 2) and that's what I had to start with. The crumb topping sounded extra yummy. The recipe I did not change at all. However, I think it is for jumbo muffins and I used regular. So to my surprise, I had a lot more mix and broke out a second muffin pan and made 18. In doing this I did adjust the cooking time so they wouldn't burn. The prep time (let's be real... 15 minutes is having everything premeasured and in front of you ready to go) it's more like 30-40 minutes and that's me cleaning as I go - putting dirty things in the dishwasher, not actually washing. I had a cooking time of 16 minutes (I like my muffins on the light and moist side). It was exactly 1 hour from start to finish turning the oven off. Cooling time was additional. I took them out of the muffin tins after 5 minutes so they wouldn't keep cooking. And they were deeelicious!!!
Loved this recipe. Better than anything store bought. Made mini muffin versions, about 28 mini muffins. Cooked at 350¬∞F for 22 minutes. Used 1 tbsp of cinnamon. Turned out scrumptious.
This was an amazing recipe!! Kids loved the crumb topping.
Husband and kids love it
Absolutely delicious and a I will definitely make these again. I added a little milk for moistness. I made 5 full size muffins instead of cupcake size and baked for 25-28 minutes.

This is an easy banana muffin recipe. There‚Äôs another recipe that I use on this site which is identical except that one adds cinnamon and nutmeg to the batter, which I like. But I did like the crumb topping on these. Moist, delicious and if you let the batter rest for a few minutes before filling the muffin tins you will get a nice high crown.
Really good, Taste great
Awesome recipe! Added brown sugar and chopped pecans to crumble topping! My husband loves them!‚ù§Ô∏è

The muffins are deadly! I try not to make them very often or give half away! I followed recipe and they were perfect. I add mini chocolate chips and/or walnuts and I get an even dozen. Definitely my go to recipe for guests!
perfect muffins! I substituted oil for butter.
Bakery quality! Made as written except I added walnuts to badder and topping. Perfection! Would make again!
Added nuts and subbed butter for oil.
I love these muffins so much! I highly recommend reducing the butter and sugar so that the muffins have a good amount of sweetness. :)
Amazing.. Added peacans. Instead of crumble, I topped with spice raw sugar. homemade

Oil was substituted for butter as in other reviews, otherwise followed recipe. Muffins good, fluffy bottom ,crunchy top but missing a touch of flavour. ( maybe add vanilla?) Topping a bit on sweet side. Batter was just enough for 10 as stated. I have had better banana muffins.
I follow this recipe every time. This is my go to recipe üòã. I also make loaves with the crumble. Soooo good
I made as the recipe states. With the topping, I did press down to ensure the topping did not fall off while baking. These are sure to be a big hit in my household!
Very delicious! I added vanilla to the mix, and cinnamon. 1/3 each of raisins and sliced almonds and a bit more butter the toppings‚Ä¶this is a keeper. Thank you so much for sharing.
Could not fault this recipe - very tasty and moist.
Super good. Banana flavor wasn't super strong which I liked.
I love making these muffin. They don't last long in the home when I make them. This time around I made them with pecan nuts. I can't wait to see how they are with nuts.
I made the recipe for the muffin just as written, but added a few (less than 1/2 cup of pecans to the crumb topping. YUM!
I doubled the recipe and made half with chocolate chips ( for my kids) Excellent recipe!! Thank you!
These are so good! I make half with chocolate chips and another without to please all members of my family!
AMAZING! All the great tastes of banana bread with that delicious brown sugar topping. I added double the amount of cinnamon to the topping just cuz its so good lol. Turned out great!

Made this recipe exactly as is and these muffins were pure perfection. I don‚Äôt understand how anyone can dislike this recipe enough to give it less than 4 stars. I will for sure be making these again.
Traditional flavor like grandma used to make. Simple, yet delicious:)
Kids loved it! Better than being at Starbucks
loved these muffins. Added cinnamon and nutmeg as others have suggested. Used oil instead of butter. These were moist and so flavorful. Love the topping! will add nuts next time. A+++++
Delish

Started my baking business and included this in my recipe! Love it most specially the crumbs on top! I hope there‚Äôs a recipe that can adjusted into US customary measurements to have it adjusted by grams, otherwise all good.
I love these muffins, I just added walnuts to the batter and topped it as well with the nuts, it's simply Delicious!
Super easy, made on my 30 min lunch break with some over ripe bananas I had hanging around. So yumm and moist !! Added pumpkin spice and walnuts to batter and gave me a nice dozen üòã

This recipe has always been my go to recipe when I have over ripe bananas. It is super moist and delicate and the streusel top almost like caramel. So good. Whenever I am looking for a recipe I always look for an Allrecipes one and have yet to be disappointed.

This is a fantastic recipe that I will be making again and again. I only had two overripe bananas in my fruit bowl, but I had a third banana in the freezer which I thawed before beginning to mix this up. If that made any difference, I certainly couldn‚Äôt detect a problem with the outcome. They are not only delicious, but they‚Äôre pretty too!
Pretty good, but I used two eggs.

Made these and they came out great! I did reduce the sugar to 1/2 cup. I did add some cinnamon to the batter as well (a quarter teaspoon) I also added a teaspoon of vanilla. These muffins are very light and great tasting. Will make again
Made these this morning, exact recipe. My kids AND neighbors couldn‚Äôt get enough!! I will make them again, and again and‚Ä¶ again üòÉ Thank you!!

Just pulled the last batch out of the oven....our home smells delicious!! Sorry about the 4 stars. The only reason was because I combined another "banana bread" recipe with this one. I too like using white sugar and brown sugar together best. (1/2c white sugar, 1/4c brown sugar instead of 3/4c white) Also, I remembered the review where someone commented on how their topping burned.....so I lowered the oven temperature to 350 for 18 minutes and they came out perfect. The crumb topping really adds to it too!! Can't wait to make these again and get creative!!
Easy and delicious!

I made the Banana Crumb muffins before and it was perfect for me, made it again today I substitute eggs for just eggs a plant based egg, honey instead of sugar and added walnuts and vanilla extract...thank you for the recipe it's delicious and divine!

Muffins were good but sweet BECAUSE I read the recipe as I go, and it wasn't specific about the sugar so I added ALL the sugar in the wet mix. Didn't ruin the recipe, but it should say "white sugar" when mixing the wet.
Easy recipe, followed recipe exactly except I baked in mini muffin pans and cooked at 350 for 13-15 min. Perfect! Yummy, loved by all!!!
Easy and delicious! Moist and lots of flavor! Only change, I added 1/2 cup of semisweet chocolate chips!
Instant family favorite. Recipe calls for 10 muffin pan, but mine are all 12 muffins so I make extra cinnamon crumb mixture to cover all 12 (there always seems to be enough batter).
So so so good
Fantastic recipe! good tip: add one large diced apple of your choosing to the batter, it tastes amazing!
Definitely the best flavored muffin recipe I've used so far. Muffin was perfectly moist and the flavor was spot on. Thank you!!
This recipe is awesome! I make these for my family all the time, and my dad eats them before they're even out of the muffin wraps. So yummy!

No question, these are the best banana muffins I‚Äôve ever tasted. Sometimes I feel like a nut (so I add walnuts or pecans), sometimes I don‚Äôt‚Ä¶but, I never make just 10. I‚Äôve tripled, quadrupled and even quintupled the recipe; they still come out perfectly moist and delicious every time.
I found this recipe years ago on this site and have been making these muffins for my family ever since! The grandkids absolutely love and request them often!
I swapped the 3/4 cup sugar with 1 cup erythritol and they were pretty good, not very sweet but also I used under ripe bananas.
My family devoured these! I made mini muffins. The best banana muffins ever.
It was a very nice recipe . I didn‚Äôt put the crumb topping as I didn‚Äôt have the things needed but without that too it was delicious I put almonds n walnuts instead
I‚Äôve made this recipe several times already. It has been a big hit with everyone!

Made exactly as directed- BEST, moist, banana muffins I've ever made- they were gone in 5 minutes! It's my new GO-TO recipe! SUGGESTION: Maybe a little more butter to the crumb topping as it was a bit drier than expected. Also, double the crumb topping (you'll have leftover topping, but it will cover all the muffins depending on how much topping you want).
I followed the recipe exactly. Great flavor. Just enough sweetness. Will make a good breakfast!!!
Made this exactly as stated except I made 8 mini loaves instead. Perfectly delish! Thank you
These were so tasty! A little sweet, next time I‚Äôll just use less of the brown sugar mixture on each but overall really easy & delicious muffins!
I made 2 batches - one with pecans and one without !!!

The muffins are amazing. 
I think I'm going to add twist next time I make them. Stay tuned.

This is the only Banana Muffin Recipe that we use.
Nothing compares to these delicious muffins
Great recipe! I made it on a snow day up here in WY. The husband loved it. Easy, quick recipe. This will be added to the recipe book for sure.
The muffin cups I used caught the extra crumble which resulted in a little extra crunch around the edge. Delicious!
I followed directions exactly and they turned out absolutely delicious! Thank you for the recipe

Best. Muffins. Ever. 2 things I would change. Only 2. For the topping only. The butter in the topping needs to be cold or it doesn‚Äôt mix. And if you saw my picture the topping didn‚Äôt stick. Awesome food but only if you‚Äôve made it before and know the changes it needs. So that makes it a 4 1/2 rating if not 4. But still best recipe I have found on AllRecipes.
The star of these muffins is the crumb top...great recipe, I didn't have or want to change a thing.
Amazing

The recipe is great for these muffins, and has been added to my trusty recipe book with the following modifications. To intensify the banana taste I baked my bananas in thier peels at 350 for 10 mins or so. They went from a couple of spots to completely brown. I subbed in 1/4 cup brown and 1/2 cup white in the batter. I took other viewers suggestions and doubling the crumb topping and adding vanilla, fresh nutmeg and cinnamon to the batter. In the end, it made 12 very full muffins in a standard size muffin tin. Happy baking!
Great recipe! I did add some vanilla and Chocolate chips, but these turned out amaaazing!
Delicious. Do it. Make them.
Just made these with the help of my two toddlers, who love to help cook! We added mini chocolate chips, and they came out so good! Will definitely be making again!
I made these muffins without any adjustments to the recipe. They were delicious!

Great recipe. I tried making it a bit healthier by making some changes suggested by others. I reduced the sugar to 1/2 C and equally split it between white an brown sugar. I added 1tsp vanilla, 1/2tsp nutmeg and 1/2tsp cinnamon. I replaced butter with 1/3C of vegetable oil. Only had 2 bananas and added 4TBLS of unsweetened apple sauce. With the flour, I split it 3/4 white and 3/4 whole wheat. Didn't add topping because I don't like overly sweet muffins for breakfast. I did add chopped walnuts. They came out perfect.
I make these all the time. My kids purposely do not eat the bananas I buy so that I will make this recipe. Better than banana bread!
I've made this recipe several times. I generally get 10 to 12 muffins depending on the size of the bananas. They turn out great every single time.
They were delicious!
Make it just as the recipe
This recipe turned out great!
Delicious! Easy! Used bottom oven with newer darker muffin tins - came out with nice high tops - better than Nikes! 9/4/2021
Very delicious . Followed recipe exactly.

I followed the ingredient recipe exactly and they turned out a little bitter and I could taste the baking soda/baking powder. I also added the topping with five minutes left hoping it would melt but not mix in. It did not. It‚Äôs just powder on top
Easy and delicious!
SO DELICIOUS ! Very easy recipe with great instructions! Made them yesterday and they‚Äôve all already been eaten!
This turned out great. Family loved them.
my whole family loves them!
I have made this recipe many times now. I shared with my daughters who have also made several times. It is, by far, the absolute BEST banana muffin ever!!!!!
This is one of the best, banana crumb muffin recipe , I've baked, it's super delicious, and moist and full of flavor

The crumble top turned into caramel and was very crunchy it cooked much faster than the muffin the muffin themselves wasn't quite savory enough to be a banana bread but not sweet enough to be a banana cake. If I had to do it over again I'd add oats to the crumble topping and crumble halfway through cooking.
This is the best banana muffins I have ever had!!! Better than any bakery! I made a vanilla glaze to top it off and it was delicious!

These muffins are perfect. I followed the recipe EXACTLY as written, and they are amazing. It made 10 beautiful muffins, and the amount of crunchy topping was spot on. Thanks for sharing this recipe with the rest of us.

Great recipe. I‚Äôm glad I took a picture before my daughter and her boyfriend found out I made them. No recipe changes since I was able to find all of the ingredients here in Italy. Definitely saving for the next batch of over ripe bananas.

Sooo yummy! Followed recipe as specified, except for the crumb topping. I added chocolate chips to batter instead of the topping. My son LOVED them!!!! They were too good for me not to try one! A lot of people skipped out on butter and subbed oil‚Ä¶. Don‚Äôt! It really adds to the flavor of the muffins!!!
This is a very good .

These are everything I needed. Quick, easy and delicious. Great for breakfast when you don‚Äôt want to wake up super early. Added a bit of vanilla extract and used light brown sugar. Next time I‚Äôll add some oats to the crumble top.
I replaced 1/2 cup white sugar with light brown sugar- these were delicious and just like banana bread in less time!
